intro: Crithodium, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Acanthaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their small, often tubular flowers and hairy foliage. Crithodium species typically thrive in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They are often found in sandy or rocky soils, and some species are used in horticulture for their ornamental value. The genus includes around 100 species, many of which are popular in rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
